::: {.cell}

The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: T7.4.web.orig v1.0.


> The indicative distribution of Urban and infrastructure lands was estimated using spatial data for night light brightness (values >0 in NCEI 2019; Cinzano, et al.  2019).

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.T7_4_web_orig))
 - Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091085))
 - Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**T7.4 Urban and industrial ecosystems**](/efg-info/T7_4.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Indicative Map (**code: T7.4.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

T7.4.WM.nwx (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/T7.4.WM.nwx_v1.0.tif) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.T7_4_WM_nwx)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
